name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Protocols of the Elders of Zion" has outlived a mountain of other conspiratorial, anti-Semitic texts. It's not correct or even original—so why has it survived for so long? Steven J. Zipperstein explains: https://t.co/Mx2KTPvJED

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: It's a good day when I get to read @UriLF at the Atlantic, and especially something this moving and resonate.
https://t.co/HbSXIIIxhW

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: The Conspiracy Theory to Rule Them All: What explains the strange, long life of The Protocols of the Elders of Zion? https://t.co/SLoiV0lgqm

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pandemic containment rules have given world leaders from Hong Kong to Chile useful cover to crack down on protests and stifle dissent, @TMclaughlin3 reports. https://t.co/wk5uweThNY

name: TheAtlantic
text: A series of recent news stories, @megangarber writes, is a testament to the unending influence of "boys will be boys": https://t.co/G46BEezhiH

name: TheAtlantic
text: Three writers offer perspectives on the shooting of Jacob Blake and the ongoing movement for police reform. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/8fnUs29rxu

name: TheAtlantic
text: Senate Democrats unveiled their plan to tackle climate change, @yayitsrob reports. It uses new goals, surges of investment, and a playbook from industrial policy to decarbonize the economy. https://t.co/w7IQZI8bVA

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump’s surrogates are referring to COVID-19 in the past tense as the virus continues to ravage America and disrupt the Republican National Convention, @russellberman writes: https://t.co/NnWyBD2zul

name: TheAtlantic
text: “I hear the door close. I turn around. And he’s right at me, pushing me against the wall.” The journalist @Tashka9 says she was assaulted by Donald Trump during a 2005 interview at Mar-a-Lago. This is her story: https://t.co/NmyOClfEdD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Like so many things in AA, the 'One day at a time' mantra seemed nonsensical at first and later became gospel," @MollyJongFast writes: https://t.co/Q9AqDRvlvB

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @SStossel: "Allow me to brag for a minute: I’m a pandemic-shutdown champion....For this superpower, I have to thank Alcoholics Anonymous." 
https://t.co/6O5jUTdMA0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Is it paranoid to tell people they can’t touch your dog? @jameshamblin offers advice on the safety and etiquette of pandemic petting: https://t.co/Pf96SHG3b8

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @laurnwilliams: We talk a lot about gentrification, but white flight is its precursor. @talmonsmith reports on the Black and Latino New Yorkers who remain loyal to the city, and the tired elitism of the “Why I Left New York” essay: https://t.co/tentMJ64fH
